text:
Why do we keep pouring time and money into a project that isn’t working? We think, “If I just keep trying, I can make this work.” It’s tough to admit we messed up. We wonder, “What else could I do with this time or cash if I just walked away now?” 

But there’s more than just sunk-cost bias (the urge to stick with something because we’ve already invested in it). Here are a few other traps to watch out for, plus some tips on how to gracefully back out with minimal fallout.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sunk-cost bias can lead to a reluctance to abandon failing projects, making it essential to recognize and avoid this and other commitment traps.
